summary: The Big Ten Conference is the oldest college sports league in the U.S., started in 1896. It was initially called the Intercollegiate Conference of Faculty Representatives. With its headquarters in Illinois, it got the name "Big Ten" as it had ten universities for many years. Now, it has expanded to 18 members and 2 affiliates. These universities are large, well-known, and mostly public, each with over 30,000 students. They are strong in research and academics, collectively having millions of alumni and billions in research funding. The conference includes schools from the Midwest, Mid-Atlantic, and now the West Coast.
title: Big Ten Conference
